Care pathways for AMI and CHF are in development to enhance bundle management across the continuum.  Educational efforts this year are aimed at System-wide utilization and adherence to the teach back method and utilization of outpatient care management for patients identified as high-risk for readmission.  A care transitions model, which includes the flow from the inpatient to the post-acute setting, has been defined and will be rolled out in Q4 of 2019.

The format and method to communicate BPCA-I findings and key information to providers is in development and impacts implementation of care redesign.  There is overlap between this work and system-wide initiatives to improve care transitions, codify care pathways, decrease mortality, and to provide the right level of care at the right time.  As a result, there is a lot of data available to providers.  An area of focus has been to understand the meaning of the data in order to provide the information to providers in a manner which is actionable.
